pageHelp.title: Configuring default values for promoted and user defined properties

moreDescription.p: If you specify a value for a user-defined property or a promoted property on the subflow and also specify a value for the same property in the subflow node in the parent flow, the value that is set in the subflow node is used.

description.p: Specify how the application is started after it is deployed or after the broker/integration server/application is restarted with the following three options:

The state of the application is under complete control of the administrator. The application will be started once the deployment has completed and will remain in started state until a stop command has been issued. Once a stop command has been issued, the application will remain in stopped state until a start command is issued. Re-deployment and restarting broker/integration server/application does not change the state of the application.

The application will always require a start command after deployment or broker/integration server/application restart. The application will be in stopped state on completion of the deployment or re-deployment and after broker/integration server/application restart. This is regardless of the previous state of the application (e.g. before re-deploy or broker/integration server/application stop).
The application will always automatically start after deployment or broker/integration server/application restart.
Specify how the message flow is started after it is deployed or after the broker/integration server/application is restarted with the following three options:

The state of the flow is under complete control of the administrator. The flow will be started once the deployment has completed and will remain in started state until a stop command has been issued. Once a stop command has been issued, the flow will remain in stopped state until a start command is issued. Re-deployment and restarting broker/integration server/application does not change the state of the flow.

The flow will always require a start command after deployment or broker/integration server/application restart. The flow will be in stopped state on completion of the deployment or re-deployment and after broker/integration server/application restart. This is regardless of the previous state of the flow (e.g. before re-deploy or broker/integration server/application stop).
The flow will always automatically start after deployment or broker/integration server/application restart.

Specify the application domain in which the assemblies called by .NETCompute nodes and ESQLs in the application are loaded, if the AppDomain attribute is not set on the .NETCompute node or the ESQL Procedure signature.
If this property is not set, the application domain in which assemblies are loaded is the name of the application.
